entry.title: How to Bulk Modify Calendar Event Context Filters Using Scripting
entry.content:
The Calendar in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) is a powerful framework for orchestrating planning processes, tasks, and workflows across teams. Each calendar event or process carries context filters ‚Äî such as Date, Version, or Proficenter etc. ‚Äî that define the specific slice of data being worked on by a team or user.

In some cases, administrators or power users may need to update these context filters in bulk, for example when moving from one fiscal year to another.

While this can be done manually using the Calendar List workspace (where multiple events can be selected and edited together), alternatively scripting provides a faster, automated way to achieve the same ‚Äî especially when you need to apply changes dynamically.

This approach is inspired by the SAP Community blog written by @mike688 
Experience Sharing ‚Äì How to Batch Modify the Assignees of Calendar Events Using Scripting in SAC, which demonstrates how to modify event assignees in bulk using the Calendar Integration API.

In this post, we extend the same idea ‚Äî but instead of assignees, we modify dimension context filters for multiple events at once.

Option 1 ‚Äì Editing Multiple Events via the SAC UI

You can update context filters directly using the Calendar List workspace:

Steps:

  1. Navigate to Calendar ‚Üí List workspace.

  2. Select multiple events that you want to modify.

  3. Click Edit Events.

  1. Choose Context, and update filters such as Date, Version, or Category.

This method works well for manual batch updates, especially when the changes are straightforward and performed occasionally.For detailed reference, see SAP‚Äôs documentation: Editing Multiple Calendar Events at Once

Option 2 ‚Äì Automating Context Filter Updates Using Scripting

The Calendar Integration API in SAC allows developers to access and modify multiple calendar tasks and processes programmatically.

You can learn more about this API and its supported operations in the official documentation: SAP Help ‚Äì Calendar Event API Reference

Below is an example that demonstrates how to batch modify Date context filters for all child events of a process. You can also modify the same script to change other dimension context filters also.

Example Scenario

Suppose your planning calendar has multiple child tasks for FY2022.
You now want to update all these tasks to FY2025 automatically.

Step 1:  Accessing the EventID of a Process

To view the event ID of an event, go to the Event Settings dialog and choose Show Details. 

Step 2: Create a story and add the below code to the story widget.

Prerequisite: Add a Calendar Integration Technical Object

Then, paste the following script:

 

// Step 1: Get main process event
//Replace XXXXXXX with Process Event ID.
var root = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById("XXXXXXXXXXXXX");

if (root === undefined) {
    Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Warning, "Invalid event ID.");
    Application.hideBusyIndicator();
    return;
}

// Step 2: Check event type
if (root.getType() !== CalendarTaskType.Process) {
    Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Warning, "Only Process type events can be modified.");
    Application.hideBusyIndicator();
    return;
}

// Step 3: Get children
var process = cast(Type.CalendarProcess, root);
var childIds = process.getChildren();

console.log("Child event IDs:");
console.log(childIds);

var targetYear = "2025"; // Enter Target new year for the child event 

// Step 4: Loop through each childs
for (var i = 0; i < childIds.length; i++) {
    var childId = childIds[i];
    console.log("Processing child ID"+childId);

    var ev = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById(childId);
    if (ev === undefined) {
        console.log("Skipping invalid child->"+childId);
		       continue;
    }

    // Step 5: Get context filters
    var ctx = ev.getContextFilters();
    console.log("Context filters for child:");
    console.log(ctx);

    // We can‚Äôt assign null ‚Üí use flag and index instead
    var hasDateFilter = false;
    var dateFilterIndex = -1;

    for (var j = 0; j < ctx.length; j++) {
        var f = ctx[j];
        if (f.members && f.members.length > 0 && f.members[0].dimensionId === "Date") {
            hasDateFilter = true;
            dateFilterIndex = j;
            break;
        }
    }

    if (hasDateFilter === false) {
        console.log("No Date filter found for"+childId);
        continue;
    }

    var dateFilter = ctx[dateFilterIndex];
console.log("datefilter");
	console.log(dateFilter);
    // Step 6: Remove old Date filter for the child event
    var removed = ev.removeContextFilter(dateFilter);
    if (removed === true) {

		console.log("Removed old Date filter for -> " + childId);

    } else {
        //console.log("Could not remove Date filter for:", childId);
        continue;
    }

    // Step 7: Build new Date filter dynamically
    var modelId = dateFilter.members[0].modelId;
    var hierarchy = dateFilter.hierarchy;

	var newDateFilter = ArrayUtils.create(Type.CalendarContextFilter); 
			

	newDateFilter = [{
    hierarchy: {
        id: "FYQP",
        description: "FYQP"
    },
    members: [
        {
            dimensionId: "Date",
            id: "[Date].[FYQP].[Date.FISCAL_YEAR].[" + targetYear + "]",
            description: targetYear,
            displayId: targetYear,
            modelId: modelId
        }
    ]
}];

    // Step 8: Add the new Date filter
  ev.addContextFilter(newDateFilter[0]);
  console.log("Added new Date filter (" + targetYear + ") for" + childId);
}

// Step 9: Done
Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Success, "Date context filters updated successfully for all child events!");
Application.hideBusyIndicator();

 

API Methods Used

MethodPurpose
getCalendarEventById()Fetches a specific event using its ID
getChildren()Retrieves all child events under a process
getContextFilters()Returns all context filters for the event
removeContextFilter()Removes an existing context filter
addContextFilter()Adds a new context filter dynamically

Summary

The Calendarevent API in SAP Analytics Cloud provides a rich set of methods that go well beyond modifying context filters.
You can reuse the same structure to perform a variety of automation and maintenance actions across the planning calendar events.

By combining UI-based editing and scripting automation, SAC administrators can achieve both flexibility and efficiency in managing planning calendars.

entry.title: Re: How do I configure a custom sales workflow in SAP‚ÄØSal...
entry.content:
Hi Suheb,

To automate in SAP Sales Cloud that, after 30 days, an opportunity automatically moves to the next sales phase or triggers the creation of a task, you need to create a scheduled (time-based) workflow rule. This rule can be based directly on the creation date or on a custom date-type field that controls when the action should be executed. In the first case, you simply define the condition ‚Äúcreation date + 30 days‚Äù and configure the action to either update the sales phase or create a task for the responsible user. In the second, more flexible approach, you can create a custom field such as ‚ÄúNext Action Date,‚Äù which is automatically updated (via workflow) with the current date plus 30 days each time the opportunity changes phase or is modified; then, a scheduled workflow rule is created so that when the date in that field is reached, it executes the corresponding action to update the phase or create a task.

Best regards,
Fernando

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration Content API - Is it possible to view all process direct endpoint value
entry.content:
Hi!

I need the same functionality: a list of all ProcessDirect endpoints alongside their corresponding iFlow names. Did you find a solution to your problem? Unfortunately, the /ServiceEndpoints API doesn't provide ProcessDirect endpoints. From my perspective, you could do the following:

  • Get all packages with the /IntegrationPackages API.
  • For each package, retrieve the list of all artefacts: /IntegrationPackages('MyPackage')/IntegrationDesignTimeArtifacts.
  • For each iFlow artefact, download the content: /IntegrationDesignTimeArtifacts(Id="MyIFlow", Version="active")/$value.
  • Unzip the content and read the file: src/main/resources/parameters.propdef.
  • Select all entries from the node: <param_references> where the attribute_id contains ProcessDirect.
<param_references> where the attribute_id contains ProcessDirect.
<reference attribute_category="Sender1" attribute_id="ctype::Adapter/cname::ProcessDirect/vendor::SAP/version::1.1.2/attrId::address" attribute_uilabel="Address" param_key="address"/>‚Äã
  • You can fetch the endpoint, which relates to the attribute param_key, from the file: src/main/resources/parameters.prop.
#
Tue Sep 09 13:24:51 UTC 2025 
address=/myEndpoint
‚Äã
  • Alternatively, use the API /IntegrationDesignTimeArtifacts(Id="MyIFlow",Version="active")/Configurations and search for the parameter key with the same value as param_key.
"ParameterKey": "address",
"ParameterValue": "/myEndpoint",‚Äã

I could not find an easier solution.

entry.title: Develop Full-Stack ABAP Applications in SAP Business Application Studio
entry.content:
The SAP Business Application Studio provides several extensions designed to streamline the development of business applications for the SAP Intelligent Enterprise.

Among these extensions is the CDS Graphical Modeler, which enables SAP business developers to visually design Core Data Service (CDS) models. Previously, this extension was available for SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) development projects.

However, with the release of SAP BTP ABAP environment 2508 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, corresponding to ABAP release 9.16, we have integrated the CDS Graphical Modeler with ABAP. This integration allows developers to create ABAP projects using the CDS Graphical Modeler to conveniently design ABAP-compliant CDS models for various scenarios in a remote ABAP system.

Ultimately, you can now build full-stack ABAP applications in SAP Business Application Studio. Once you've created an ABAP project, you can model business objects, generate ABAP CDS artifacts, integrate a user interface, and deploy your application to the appropriate environments, such as SAP BTP ABAP environment or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Curious how this works? Check out our documentation on SAP Help Portal for detailed instructions: Develop Full-Stack ABAP Applications in SAP Business Application Studio.

But you‚Äôre short on time or just looking for a quick peek? Keep reading! üòâ

1. Set Up Your Full-Stack ABAP Project:

In the SAP Build Lobby, choose Create right above the project list and select Create from the drop-down menu. This opens the Create Project dialog.

Project creation screen with options for Application, Automated Process, and Business Site, highlighting Application with a "Next" button.

In the Create Project dialog, select Application, click Next, select Full-Stack, advance with Next, and finally select Full-Stack ABAP (SAP Business Application Studio).

"Full-Stack ABAP (SAP Business Application Studio)" option is selected for creating a project with a "Next" button available.

Advance with Next and specify the target ABAP system and configure the project details.
Once the project is created, a Core Schema Notation Model is created in the remote ABAP system, and the remote ABAP package path is added to the workspace. The project then opens in the Storyboard.

2. Model Your Application:

From the Storyboard, you can model your ABAP application using the CDS Graphical Modeler to define and visualize your ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP) business objects, projections, and services relevant to your application development.

Storyboard offers options to create a business object, projection, service, or UI application with corresponding plus buttons.

 Choose + in the Create an entity field to add the business object entities and define their relationship for the business service.

Note: Next to the Business Object modeler, you see your CSN file. This file resides on your ABAP system in the package you created previously. This file is used by the modeler to store your model. You should not edit this file manually since this can damage the integrity of the model.

Proceed with adding projections to specify which elements of a business object are exposed in the business service.

Add a business service and select which entities to expose in the service.

Storyboard shows the relation of business objects, projections, and services and an option to create a new UI application.

You are now all set to generate the ABAP backend artefacts from the modeled business objects, projections, and services. Close the Business Services modeler and return to the Storyboard.

3. Generate ABAP CDS Artifacts:

Once you have modeled your ABAP application, you need to generate the ABAP development objects based on the data model created with the CDS Graphical Modeler, including DDIC tables, CDS views, metadata extensions, and service definitions.

From the Storyboard, choose Generate and follow the steps in the wizard to perform validation checks and complete the generation process.
As a result, a read-only RAP OData UI service is generated and available in the service catalog. On the ABAP side, the development objects are activated, and the service binding is published.

4. Add a User Interface and Deploy Your Application:

As a last step, you need to create a user interface for your RAP service by generating a SAP Fiori UI application that you can then deploy to an appropriate environment, such as SAP BTP ABAP Environment or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

From the Storyboard, choose + in the UI Applications field to open the SAP Fiori Generator wizard and provide the required inputs for your UI development. To deploy the application, choose Deploy from the Application Information tab.

 

And that's it! You've successfully developed a full-stack ABAP application in SAP Business Application Studio‚Äîquickly and effortlessly in just a few steps.

What do you think of it? We would love to hear your thoughts! Share your feedback in the comments below.

Dear ,

You can use the below update query to fix the issue 

SELECT * FROM OITM WHERE "TreeType"<>'N' and "ItemCode" not in (select "Code" from OITT);

UPDATE OITM SET "TreeType"='N' where "TreeType"<>'N' and "ItemCode" not in (select "Code" from OITT);

Regards,

Prince Ebi

entry.title: Re: Group reporting + data collection + SAC - SAP Public...
entry.content:
Hi,

Think it might be difficult for you.

In Public Cloud you are not able to create additional chart of accounts. All your 15 clients would have the same Y1 standard. You will be able to create additional FS items but with 15 different clients... 

You will be able to create multiple versions, one for each client, to separate transactional data access but you need to be strict with your naming convention to create a close to viable authorization setup.

For GRDC you will have only 1. There can only be one connected GRDC. This means all input forms are shared: client 1 can look and change the layout of client 2. You don't authorize on individual forms or folders but on access to the Fiori tile.

Then if you have that the client will have super admin users and perhaps someone to maintain users and roles these you might have difficulties restricting not to have any access between your clients.

I can see you properly have some hosting revenue but you might  be better of recommending each of your clients to have their own public cloud.

Br

Martin Jul

Hi,

Currently, we do have a defect regarding add a Global Assignment for users with dependents which has been documented in the below KBA
https://me.sap.com/notes/0003677647 The workaround is as below:
Workaround:
       1.Please import the Global Assignments via Import Employee data.
       2.Enable the field "is-accompanying-dependent" under Dependents Information in Manage Business Configuration.
You can follow up on this KBA for any updates related to code correction However, if your issue is not related to dependents then you can raise a ticket to SAP for investigation, thanks.

Best regards,

Elsa

entry.title: üá∞üáº Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core (Kuwait)
entry.content:
Before diving into the AI Hackathon, kickstart your preparation with an SAP CodeJam workshop. This hands-on session is designed to help you develop your use case with confidence, offering a practical introduction to SAP AI technologies led by an expert instructor.

In this SAP CodeJam, you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to work with LLMs and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use embeddings to improve your RAG response and build your own chatbot with memory. 

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Monday, December 8, 2025, at Kuwait University, University Administration Building, Sabah al-Salem, Academic City, from 10:00 to 16:00 local time.

The binding registration for this event is via the form: https://forms.office.com/e/nCj7stjw4g  

The event's language and content will be in English. 

Prerequisites: Bring your own laptop with a Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, etc.

Please note that spaces are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis.

entry.title: Re: Professional service Projects
entry.content:
Hello @sanne_larsen 

Thank you for your question.

You can consult the following references for further details.

Blogs: 4E9-New Project Billing Configuration and Process, Project Billing for Customer Projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Professional Services in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition 2302

Links: Event-Based Revenue Recognition for Fixed Price Service Orders

Customer Projects with Event-Based Revenue Recognition

To summarise, in public cloud, the choice between Periodic Service and Fixed Price Service projects defines how and when your revenue is recognised.

  • If you have ongoing subscription-type engagements (e.g., managed services), where your revenue is recognised periodically based on elapsed time or incurred costs, then Periodic Service will be the ideal solution for you.
  • However, if you are focused on project-based engagements, where the revenue is recognised based on every achieved milestone or upon fulfilment of specific deliverables, then Fixed Price Service is the better fit.

If your customer‚Äôs business is shifting toward deliverable-based billing, you should define new projects where you use the Fixed Price Service setup. However, both models can also coexist if you segment your project billing items appropriately.

Manage Project Billing (helps you check contract type) and Run Revenue Recognition (helps you simulate accounting results) can help you review and simulate revenue timing

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Outlook for 2602 - 'AI-assisted permit management'
entry.content:
The 'AI-assisted permit management' innovation will help an Environmental Manager by significantly accelerating and simplifying the process of handling environmental permits. The process works in three main steps:
1. Import & Setup: The manager will import the environmental permit as a PDF document into the system.
2. Header Identification: The AI will automatically detect header information from the document's first page to help set up the permit's general data in the system.
3. Requirement Extraction & Task Proposal: The AI will extract compliance requirements from the permit text and automatically proposes corresponding operational tasks, such as data collection or reporting.

With the help of this innovation the manager will be able to review, accept, or deny these proposed tasks. This reduces manual effort, minimizes human error, lowers operational costs, and helps ensure compliance to avoid potential penalties. Stay tuned for the 2602 release!

entry.title: API Execution Failed When Trying to Use ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù Feature in SAP Cloud Integration API on BTP Trial
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently ran into an issue while experimenting with SAP Cloud Integration on my SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Trial Account, and I wanted to share my experience here in case anyone else has faced something similar‚Äîor if someone can point me in the right direction.

Scenario

As part of my learning journey in SAP Integration Suite, I created an Integration Flow (iFlow) in Cloud Integration (CPI) and successfully deployed it.

Then, I exposed the iFlow as an API through the API Management capability of BTP so that I could access it externally via a REST API call.

Everything went smoothly until I tried to test the API using the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature from SAP API Business Hub.

Steps Followed

  1. Logged in to my SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Opened Integration Suite ‚Üí Cloud Integration.

  3. Created and deployed an iFlow that returns some sample data.

  4. Exposed the iFlow as an API Proxy using API Management ‚Üí Design ‚Üí API Proxies.

  5. Opened the Cloud Integration API package on SAP API Business Hub.

  6. Clicked ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù to test one of the APIs (for example, /MessageProcessingLogs).

  7. Given the clientid and clientsecret from instance default_it-rt_integration-flow and also I tried with my BTP sign inuser id and password and it shows API execution failed. Please try again.

    Issue Facing

    When I clicked Execute, the system returned the following message:

    API execution failed. Please try again.

    No additional error details were displayed in the response window, and the API call did not reach my iFlow endpoint.

    Troubleshooting Attempted

    Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve tried so far:

    • Verified that the iFlow is deployed and active.

    • Checked the runtime URL from the Monitor ‚Üí Manage Integration Content page.

    • Verified that my trial tenant is active and not in suspended state.

    • Checked API Business Hub ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature for other packages ‚Äî same issue occurs, which might indicate an environment limitation.

      My Understanding So Far

      It seems that the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature on SAP API Business Hub might not support BTP Trial environments for certain APIs, especially those requiring authenticated connections to Cloud Integration runtime.

      In a productive BTP setup (non-trial), the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù function usually works fine when proper credentials and destinations are configured.

      Request for Help

      Has anyone successfully used the Cloud Integration API ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature with a Trial account?
      If so, could you please share:

      • Any specific configuration or destination settings needed for trial accounts

      • Whether OAuth token-based authentication is mandatory

      • Or if this limitation is by design for BTP Trial users

        Conclusion

        I‚Äôm learning a lot about SAP Integration Suite and the API Management capabilities on BTP.
        Even though I‚Äôve hit this roadblock, it‚Äôs been a great opportunity to understand how authentication and API exposure work behind the scenes in the SAP ecosystem.

        Would love to hear from the community if anyone has faced and resolved this issue! üôå

entry.title: Auto Top N sort order mismatch in SAC optimized story
entry.content:
Hello Community,

‚ñ†EnvironmentÔºö
„ÄÄSAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Optimized Story Experience

‚ñ†Problem / PhenomenonÔºö
„ÄÄPhenomenon: Automated Top N Sort Order Mismatch
„ÄÄI am using the Optimized Story Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

„ÄÄWhen a chart's dimension members exceed the visualization limit, the Automatic Top N filter is applied by the system as expected.

„ÄÄHowever, the resulting sort order of this automatically applied Top N (e.g., Top 10) does not align with the sort order of a manually configured Descending Sort (on a bar chart) or a Manual Top N filter.


„ÄÄIn short, the automated Top N function appears to be using a sort criterion other than the core measure, leading to inconsistent results across charts.

‚ñ†Details and Verification ResultsÔºö
The analysis uses the following structure:

Dimension: [Dimension01] (114 unique members)
Measure: [measure01]


As shown in the attached image, the Automatic Top N result is inconsistent with the results from the Manual Top N and the Table Chart (All Data Sorted Descending by Measure01).


‚ñ†Verification Steps:

Verification 1: The manual sort using Measure01 matches the "All Data" Table/Bar Chart result.

Verification 2: We confirmed that the Automatic Top N is NOT sorting based on our intended measure (Measure01).

Verification 3: We created a separate table to verify the Record Count (Count of Records) for each member, and the Automatic Top N is NOT sorting by Record Count either.

Verification 4: No Top N or Rank filter is visible in the Builder/Filter panel of the automatically restricted chart.

‚ñ†Specific QuestionÔºö

Given that the sort order does not match either Measure01 or the number of records, what criteria (what sort order) does the automatic Top N function in SAC's optimized stories use to perform the default sorting?

Is the system referencing a hidden default measure or an internal sort mechanism that is not accessible to the user? Knowing the criteria is essential for understanding the data presented.

If anyone knows about this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Re: Browser Access not working from user system (same net...
entry.content:
Check this first:

  1. Open the Browser Access Service Settings:

    • On the server, go to SAP Business One Service Manager.

    • Select Browser Access Service from the dropdown.

    • Click Settings.

  2. In the ‚ÄúHost Name‚Äù field, make sure it‚Äôs set to the server‚Äôs actual name or IP address, not localhost.

  • Save and restart the Browser Access Service.

Verify the correct PORT is open and reachable:

The default Browser Access dispatcher port is typically 8100 or 8443, depending on your setup.

Test from a client system:

  • Open Command Prompt on the user‚Äôs PC and run:

     
    ping <ServerName>

    (If ping fails, there‚Äôs a name resolution or network issue.)

  • Then check if the port is reachable:

     
    telnet <ServerName> <Port>

    or

     
    Test-NetConnection <ServerName> -Port <Port>

    (in PowerShell)

If this test fails, your issue is almost certainly firewall or port binding

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Replication Mode in Com...
entry.content:
Hello Simon,

I'll just share my thoughts with you. From my understanding you first set the parameter to I (Initial Replication) in the communication arrangement to let the system know that you want to do an initial load. This by itself does not replicate anything yet. Then you can trigger the initial load in the app Replicate by Replication Model where you choose initial load again. If I understand correctly, that also means if you have the communication arrangement set to C and you want to run an initial load from the Replicate by Replication Model App, it does not work. But it's only from the top of my head, I didn't verify this right now. If this is incorrect, please let me know.

After that you would change the communication arrangement to C (Change Replication) so that changes will be captured. With output mode D (Direct Replication) the changes will be replicated directly and with output mode P (Pooled Replication) the changes will be gathered and the replication will be triggered later by a batch job. For that you have to maintain the job execution settings for the replication model in the communication arrangement.

 

In this guide at page 28 you can find some explanations for the basic settings in the communication arrangement 6KO_Set-Up_EN_XX.pdf

and here in 7. d. is some basic information about the output modes SAP-Help 

Kind regards,

Niklas

entry.title: Re: project valuation class does not work
entry.content:
Hi friend,
Actually, the issue is that the system did not recognize the project-specific valuation class (QKLAS) during MIGO because the valuation type was not properly determined or assigned for the WBS element. You must follow below mentioned points to investigate why it's not determined.

1. Valuation Type Determination
SAP uses the valuation type to differentiate between standard and project valuation classes. If the valuation type is not explicitly maintained or determined during the PO or GR process, the system defaults to the standard valuation class (BKLAS). Please check the valuation type linked to the WBS element in the project definition? If not, the system won‚Äôt switch to QKLAS.

2. Split Valuation Configuration
For project valuation to work, the material must be set up for split valuation. Look into the material master, is split valuation active? Is the valuation category (e.g., ‚ÄòProject‚Äô) assigned? If split valuation isn‚Äôt active, SAP cannot differentiate between standard and project stock.

3. Valuation Class Mapping in OBYC
OBYC-BSX must have separate accounts for each valuation class. Are both BKLAS and QKLAS mapped correctly in OBYC under BSX? If QKLAS is missing or misconfigured, the system may default to BKLAS.

4. Account Assignment Category Q Behavior
When using account assignment category Q (project), SAP expects a WBS element with valuated stock. Is the WBS element flagged for valuated stock in the project system? If not, SAP treats it as non-valuated and uses standard valuation.

5. PO and GR Settings
During PO creation, the valuation type should be selectable or defaulted based on the WBS. Was the valuation type field visible and filled in ME21N? If not, it may need to be enabled via configuration. During MIGO, if the valuation type is not editable or defaulted incorrectly, the GR will post to the wrong account.

Following are my recomendations mentioned below.
Enable split valuation for the material and assign valuation category.
Assign valuation type to WBS element in the project definition.
Ensure OBYC-BSX has correct GL accounts for both BKLAS and QKLAS.
Check PO and GR screens to ensure valuation type is visible and correctly defaulted.
Test with a new PO after correcting the above to confirm correct account posting.

Hope your issue can be fixed with above actions.

entry.title: Re: eDocument SII ‚Äì Canceled invoice before submission does not generate ‚Äúaccepted‚Äù status
entry.content:
Good day!

Dear customer, to answer your question, I will need some clarifications.

Regular submission process (let's take 1 document for example) is the following:

  1. You create an Accounting document (using FB01, for example)
  2. You run a eDoc creation report ESSII_EDOCCREATE - Create eDocuments for SII (Spain). Spain SII eDocument is created and is visible in eDocument Cockpit
  3. You run a eDoc List creation report ESSII_EDOCLIST - Create eDoc Lists for SII (Spain). Spain SII List eDocument is created and is visible in eDocument Cockpit.
  4. You submit this List eDocument to Tax Authorities and recieve their response (Accepted or Rejected). Both List and individual eDocuments statuses are updated.

When you describe your situation, what do you cancel? Individual eDocument or actual SAP Accounting documents? And when does that happen, after the individual eDocument is created or after List is created?

entry.title: SAP for Me for Partners - Recent Updates to the Customer Success Dashboard
entry.content:
Dear Partners,

We are excited to announce the release of new features in the Customer Success dashboard in SAP for Me.

Projects Tab:

Global Project View for Partner Groups

Partners who are part if a Partner Grouping Agreement (PGA) can have visibility on all projects across the partner group in the Customer Cloud Projects card. This supports partners who are involved in multi-county implementations to have full transparency on the project delivery across countries. Partner group-level visibility provides partners with a comprehensive view of all projects across their affiliated entities, reducing fragmentation and improving oversight.

To access this view, select the ‚ÄúGlobal View‚Äù

 

Clean Core Quality Gate Status

Partners can now have visibility to the status of customer‚Äôs Clean Core Quality Gate status for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition projects via the Customer Cloud Projects card. Clean Core Quality Gates are checkpoints at the end of Prepare (QG1), Explore (QG2), Realize (QG3) and the beginning of Run (QG5), designed to ensure that project‚Äôs clean core principles and project tasks adhere to best practices and quality standards.  The complete status indicates the Q-gate is completed in Cloud ALM, clean core report is generated via CQC service and delivered to customer in their Cloud ALM instance.  All QGs need to be completed for new implementation; QG5 is required for Lift & Shift.Refer to this guide (link) to learn more about Clean Core Projects.

 

Project Manager Maintenance

Project managers are crucial for successful customer projects. We‚Äôve added a feature in SAP for Me to let partner search and assign a user as project manager when they register a new project.  This information allows closer alignment between the Partners and SAP teams.  The Project Manager contact is also visible on the Customer Cloud Projects Card.

Renewals Tab:

New Renewal Forecast card

We have introduced a new Renewal Forecast card to support partners with their renewals and churn management. In this new card, partners have visibility to renewal opportunities with renewal date within the current quarter and the next four quarters. Partners can switch views to identify renewal opportunities with missing forecast and renewal opportunities with less than 50% probability. Partners can also easily navigate to the Deal Manager from the card to update the opportunities.

View Upcoming Renewals for the current quarter and the next 4 quarters:

View Renewals with Forecast Missing:

entry.title: Re: Recurring Inspection Lot error in SAP QM
entry.content:
Hi,
What I understand that the stock is not moving to Quality Inspection and the missing Inspection Lot Stock tab in QA07 are likely due to configuration or master data issues‚Äîespecially with inspection type 09 and batch settings.

Stock Not moving
Inspection Lot Creation Timing
In QA07, recurring inspection lots are created based on the next inspection date and the lead time. If the batch expiration or next inspection date is not within the opening period defined in QA07, the lot won't be created.

Inspection Type 09 Configuration
Ensure that inspection type 09 is activated in the material master under the QM view. The control indicator ‚ÄúStock transfer at inspection lot creation‚Äù must be set to move stock from unrestricted to quality inspection.

Batch Master Data
The batch must have a valid next inspection date and shelf life data maintained in the material master (Plant Data/Storage 1 view). If these are missing or incorrect, the system won‚Äôt trigger the inspection lot or stock movement.

QA07 Parameters
In QA07, check the parameter ‚ÄúTransfer to inspection stock‚Äù: If set to ‚ÄúAt inspection date,‚Äù stock won‚Äôt move until that date. If set to ‚ÄúAt lot creation,‚Äù stock should move immediately‚Äîmake sure this is selected.


Stock tab missing in QA07
No Stock Posted to the Lot
If no stock was moved to Quality Inspection, the tab won‚Äôt appear because there‚Äôs nothing to post or decide on.

Inspection Lot Origin
For recurring inspections (origin 09), if the stock isn‚Äôt batch-managed or the lot isn‚Äôt linked to a batch with stock, the tab may not be relevant.

Lot Status
Check the status of the inspection lot in QA03. If it‚Äôs not ‚ÄúREL‚Äù (Released) or doesn‚Äôt have stock assigned, the tab won‚Äôt show.

Hope you can find the reason for both of the issues. if fixed please confirm.

Good day @yKim

Thank you for your question.

You can consult the following references for further details.

Batch Management, Material Documents Overview & Batch Information Cockpit.

In summary, the public cloud does not provide standard field that directly displays the ‚Äúdays since last goods receipt‚Äù. However, the system provides you supported options such as:

  • Making use of the Manage Batch Information Cockpit app. This enables you review the last goods receipt date for each batch.
  • The ‚ÄúMaterials Overview‚Äù app helps you use the movement type 101 to track GR posting.
  • You can also make use Custom Analytical Query to create a calculated field to enable you dynamically display elapsed days.
  • Finally, the Shelf-Life Management option enables the use of expiration tracking for time-sensitive materials.

I recommend the clean-core approach where you build a Custom Analytical Query. You can use I_MaterialDocumentItem or I_Batch as your data source and add a calculated field for ‚ÄúDays Since GR‚Äù. This will ensure you comply with public cloud extensibility standards.

 

Below is a guidance.

In your Tenant, search for Batch Information Cockpit app.

Filter for your target Material, relevant batch number. Select the batch details view and confirm last goods receipt date field. Save and preview the results. You will see a calculated ‚ÄúDays Since GR‚Äù column.

You can optionally use Custom Analytical Query to add DaysSinceGR= CurrentDate-LastGoodsReceiptDate as a formular.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Exception Handling in SAP BTP Integration Sutie using AI Utility - Part 1
entry.content:
Exception handling in SAP BTP Integration Suite with AI Utility  - Part 1 

Hello!

I spent a lot of time fixing failed integraitons in SAP BTP. the messages were confusing and the business team had no idea what to do next. To help everyone, I built as simple setup that keeps the main business flow running , writes clear error messages and tells the right people what happened. This is the first part of the story. 

What you will learn here 
1. The difference between synchronous and asynchronous error handling 
2. How to finish the main work even when an error appears
3. How I used Google Gemini to rewrite technical errors in plain words
4. How ServiceNow and Loggly receive alerts from the flow 
5. Tips you can reuse in your own projects. 

Synchronous vs Asynchronous - Picking the Right path

Before you build, check how your sender and receiver expect to talk to each other

Synchronous integrations 
1. Example adapters: IDoc or HTTP on the sender , SFTP on the receiver 
2. Goal : Deliver the main message even if the error handling part fails 
3. Helpful tool : Escalation End events in the exception subprocess. They let the utility work fail without stopping the main branch. 

Example: An HTTP flow checks connectivity, write sthe file to SFTP, and only then triggers the error utility. If the utility fails, the Esclation End hands control back to the main path so the main message still succeds

Asynchronous integrations 
1. Same adapters, but the sender does not wait for a quick reply
2. Message move to their own schedule , so you can leave our Esclations Ends. 
3. Use JMS to butter and retry without blocking the main process

Why it works : This style handles more volume , keeps parts seperate and limits the blast radius when something fails. 

Two Flows working together 



I split the solution into two parts so each one can stay simple. 

Main Integration flow : 
1. Receives HTTP calls from other systesm
2. Checks services like loggly or ServiceNow to make sure they are alive
3. Saves good messages to SFTP
4. Forwards error details to the helper flow
5. Finishes even if the helper runs into trouble

GenAI utility flow
1. Picks up the error details 
2. Calls Google Gemini to explain the error in plain English
3. Converts the result into a standard XML format 
4. Sends alerts out to ServiceNow and Loggly. 

Why this setup helps
1. business processing keeps working even when utilities fail 
2. People get error summaries they can understand 
3. Alerts each several teams at once
4. Flows can run in parallel without slowing down
5. Each flow is eassier to change th e rest

Coming Up Next

Part 2 will show : 
1. How to build the main flow step by step 
2. Groovy code that talks to Gemini
3. ServiceNow and Loggly configurations
4. Testing ideas and quick fixes. 
5. Lessons from real project work. 

Stay tuned for the next part.

entry.title: Highlights from the Community Booth at the SAP Transformation Excellence Summit 2025 in the Hague
entry.content:
Last week we had the pleasure of connecting with so many of our community members at the SAP Transformation Excellence Summit 2025 in the Hague. What an inspiring few days it was, full of energy, ideas, and meaningful conversations about the future of business transformation. 

Outside the event venue - World Forum, The Hague, Netherlands

This year‚Äôs event took place at the World Forum, an iconic venue that has hosted many global discussions about change and progress. It was the perfect setting for exploring the transformations shaping our business world today. 

Our theme this year, ‚ÄúPower Up,‚Äù focused on how SAP‚Äôs integrated toolchain helps organizations accelerate transformation across processes, people, and technology. Many of the discussions at the booth centered around how SAP Signavio, SAP LeanIX, and WalkMe‚Ñ¢ work together to guide our customers in building capabilities that transform business across applications, processes, people, and data. 

 At the Community Booth, we had the opportunity to meet many of our community members face to face: customers, partners, and practitioners who bring our digital communities to life every day. Thank you to everyone who stopped by to share your stories, ask questions, and exchange insights. Your passion for collaboration and continuous learning is what makes our community thrive. (Sharing some pictures below from the booth with some of our attendees & community members.) 

  

For those who‚Äôd like to keep the momentum going, here are a few ways to stay connected: 

  • Engage with practitioners and enterprise architects in the SAP LeanIX Community to explore modernization and architecture best practices. 
  • Visit the SAP Signavio Community topic page and join us for the upcoming SAP Signavio Community expert session ‚ÄúHow to Establish a Business Process Office to Unleash Your Business Transformation‚Äù on November 19. Register here. 
  • Join/start a discussion in the Business Transformation Group and exchange ideas with peers across industries. 
  • Connect with the Business Transformation Network ‚Äì a trusted global network where companies from different industries and countries exchange learnings, challenges, and best practices. In 2024, the Network hosted more than 330 peer-to-peer exchange sessions and over 20 networking events both virtually and onsite. Topics include SAP‚Äôs own transformation journey from strategy to execution, as well as value management, finance transformation, business process management, enterprise architecture, and change management. To learn more or to get involved, contact transformation@sap.com 

 Lastly, I just want to say a big thank-you to our community members here who joined us in The Hague and contributed to making #SAPTES2025 such a big success. Your engagement, insights, and collaboration continue to power up our global SAP Community. (For those who couldn‚Äôt attend but are interested in the keynotes and sessions presented at the event, I‚Äôm happy to share the event recordings once we have them ready.) 

Please also feel free to share your feedback with us about #SAPTES2025, we would love to know ‚Äì what did you learn, like or enjoy at the event? What would you like to have at the next event? 

We look forward to seeing even more of you at future events, both online and in person. Let‚Äôs keep building the connections that drive transformation forward and keep powering up together. 

SAP BTM Community team

entry.title: SII tip for Spain #5C: SII Adjustments for Canary Islands October 2025 - <BienInversion> and "AJ"
entry.content:
As mentioned in the publication SII tip for Spain #5: SII Adjustments for Canary Islands October 2025, the Canary Islands Tax Agency published the Order of July 10, 2025 modifying Order of 11 October 2018  containing a set of changes in the Canary Islands SII format. In the Annex of this Order, the technical specifications are detailed. In that publication, the new regimes and the AIEM adjustment were mentioned.

In that earlier post, we covered the new regimes and the AIEM adjustment.
In this second part, we focus on two additional changes introduced by the Tax Agency:

Key Enhancements for SAP Customers

  1. Capital Goods Identification
    SAP customers operating in the Canary Islands can now identify incoming invoices related to capital goods (Bienes de inversi√≥n).
  2. Adjustment Document Type ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù
    For Travel Agencies (REAV) and Used Goods Schema (REBU), it is now possible to record adjustments using a new document type: AJ.

 

 

 

Capital Goods

Similar to SII-Spain, it is possible to mark certain tax codes as "Capital Goods" relevant.

Configuration path: SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> eDocument -> Country/Region-Specific Settings -> Spain -> Settings for Electronic IGIC Register Books With SII -> Assign Additional Attributes to Input Tax Codes for IGIC (SSCUI 107267)

In this customizing activity, you can select "Capital Goods" in the "Attributes" column.

When a tax code is marked as Capital Goods, invoices using this tax code will populate the XML tag:

<BienInversion>S</BienInversion>

Adjustment documents (REBU and REAV)

The special VAT schemas REBU (used goods) or REAV (travel agencies) calculate IGIC and tax base amounts based on estimated profit margins for the invoicing period. At year-end, margins are recalculated, which may require adjustments.

(*) This calculation is not part of the SAP standard.

Once the new margin is calculated, adjustments to IGIC and tax base amounts (positive or negative) can be reported to the Tax Agency using the new document type ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù.

Configuration Path: SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> eDocument -> Country/Region-Specific Settings -> Spain -> Settings for Electronic IGIC Register Books With SII -> Assign SII Attributes to Document Types for IGIC (SSCUI 102992). Mark the relevant accounting document type as "AJ".

 

The IGIC adjustment will be reported as follows:

 

Validation Rules:

  • Fields not reported in the XML message:
    • <FechaOperacion> (Tax fulfillment)
    • Block <Contraparte> (receiver)
  • Mandatory fields:
    • <TipoImpositivo> 
    • <BaseImponible>
    • <CuotaRepercutida>
  • Fixed fields:
    • <TipoFactura> is "AJ"
    • <ClaveRegimenEspecialOTrascendencia> must be either ‚Äú03‚Äù (REBU) or ‚Äú05‚Äù (REAV)
    • <TipoDesglose> must contain only <DesgloseFactura>
    • <TipoNoExenta> = ‚ÄúS1‚Äù 

 

 

 

Disclaimer

This blog post is intended for informational purposes only and reflects a simplified configuration approach based on current legal and system understanding. It does not constitute legal or implementation advice. SAP system behavior may vary depending on version, scope, and customer-specific settings. For full compliance and implementation support, please consult your SAP implementation partner or legal advisor.

 

Related links

In case of additional questions, you can refer to the official SAP documentation:

  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Private Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in ERP

Other SII tips and community discussions:

  • Spain ‚Äì SAP Document and Reporting Compliance ‚Üí Related Links ‚Üí Community Section

entry.title: Transitioning from Underwriting to Operational Risk Management
entry.content:
Hello SAP Signavio Community,

Hello Everyone,

I‚Äôm transitioning from a Life Insurance Underwriting background into Operational Risk Management, where I use process analysis and simulation to uncover potential operational inefficiencies and risks.

Drawing on my industry experience, I‚Äôm running a personal BPMN project on a fictional but representative company, Nova Life Assurance Ltd  Using SAP Signavio, I‚Äôm mapping key processes, simulating bottlenecks, identifying Key Risk Indicators (KRIs), and proposing TO-BE improvements.

I need feedback on how to improve my BPMN diagram before simulating the process and analysing the outcome. The link to my BPMN Files is attached below.

Onboarding Process - Tied Agent 

Onboarding Process - Independent Agent 

Case Scenario 

 

I will start with Sales & Distribution Processes
Note:

Distribution is done through these channels:

  • Tied Agents ‚Äì Full-time agents serving retail clients (60% of business)

  • Independent Agents ‚Äì Freelance producers on commission

  • Bancassurance Partners ‚Äì Bank officers cross-selling life policies

  • Brokerage & Corporate Sales ‚Äì Handling institutional clients

It‚Äôs led by the Head of Sales & Distribution, with support from the Retail Team, Sales Administration, and Sales Operations units.

I‚Äôve modelled  two onboarding workflows:

  1. Tied Agent Onboarding
    Supervisors recruit, screen, and forward qualified candidates to the Sales Administrator, who manages regulatory licensing with the NIC, creates agent codes, and distributes contracts.
  2. Independent Agent Onboarding
    The Sales Administrator maintains a market database, shortlists agents on request, seeks approval from the Head of Sales, negotiates terms, and activates approved agents after contract signing.

    Next Steps:

    Both workflows seem to be manual and sequential, exposing the company to potential delays. My next phase involves:

    • Simulating the processes in Signavio to measure cycle time

    • Identifying KRIs linked to operational inefficiency

    • Designing TO-BE workflows with automation and standardised approvals

entry.title: Re: Wireshark with SAP Dissectors for Ubuntu and macOS
entry.content:
So got this working with Ubuntu 22.04 arm64 with Gnome Desktop installed (see the above blog for how to set up such a distro, if you are not experienced in Ubuntu installation - from e.g. https://ubuntu.com/download/server/arm you can go to "Alternative and previous releases" to find the 22.04 variants).

But don't bother installing Wireshark just yet.

[

But if you already have Wireshark PPA and from it a Wireshark app: we need to remove Wireshark and remove the PPA. Maybe PPA first:

sudo add-apt-repository --remove ppa:wireshark-dev/stable -y

sudo apt update

Then get rid of Wireshark app itself:

sudo apt remove --purge wireshark wireshark-dev wireshark-common -y

sudo apt autoremove

]

Now we want Wireshark 3.6.x, so we should add the PPA for Bionic (Ubuntu 18.04):

https://launchpad.net/~wireshark-dev/+archive/ubuntu/stable/

sudo add-apt-repository 'deb https://ppa.launchpadcontent.net/wireshark-dev/stable/ubuntu bionic main'

sudo add-apt-repository 'deb-src https://ppa.launchpadcontent.net/wireshark-dev/stable/ubuntu bionic main'

sudo apt update

sudo apt-get install wireshark wireshark-dev

We choose Yes when prompted for the non-root user approach to dumpcap.

sudo usermod -a -G wireshark $USER
sudo setcap cap_net_raw,cap_net_admin+eip /usr/bin/dumpcap

Reboot machine to make sure all the new config gets picked up.

sudo apt install git
git clone https://github.com/SecureAuthCorp/SAP-Dissection-plug-in-for-Wireshark/
cd SAP-Dissection-plug-in-for-Wireshark/
mkdir build
cd build
sudo apt install cmake
sudo apt install build-essential
cmake ..
make

At first I thought "och naw, ended in errors", but actually it built the SAP Dissectors plugin:

[100%] Linking CXX shared module sap.so

[100%] Built target sap

On the other hand it gives a load of warnings when dealing with vpa108csulzh.cpp, whatever that is:

/home/marmot/SAP-Dissection-plug-in-for-Wireshark/src/vpa108csulzh.cpp:443:16: warning: ISO C++17 does not allow ‚Äòregister‚Äô storage class specifier [-Wregister]

  443 |   REGISTER int bitcount;

      |                ^~~~~~~~

Aha, it's related to the LZH decompression algorithm used by SAPDIAG etc:

https://www.coresecurity.com/core-labs/advisories/sap-lzc-lzh-compression-multiple-vulnerabilities#:~:text=The%20following%20piece%20of%20code%20shows%20the,vpa108csulzh.cpp%20in%20the%20MaxDB%20source%20code%20%5B12%5D.

Possibly this warning can be removed by removing the word "REGISTER" from the source code, though didn't bother trying this. Instead we anyway continue the installation workflow:

make install

/home/marmot/.local/lib/wireshark/plugins/3.6/epan/sap.so

Now we can open Wireshark and the SAP Dissectors should work fine:
